IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To foster relationships among the University of Maine and its Alumni
IRS990.MissionDescription: We represent the interests of all Alumni who share the common bond of having attended the University. We represent their thinking and their expectations to the University's leadership, to the student community, and to the residents and elected officials of Maine. We are the independent voice of the Alumni.We also represent the interests of the University to all Alumni.From our unique vantage point, we provide alumni with relevant programs, events, networking, information, and incentives to encourage them to engage in an enriching lifelong connection with the University that benefits both the University and the Alumni.
IRS990.Description: UM Alumni Association promotes the University's presence and maintains contacts with Alumni; encourages awareness of the University's role in community and the goals of higher education. Services all Alumni of the University of Maine.

Activity2.Description: UM Alumni class funds maintain contacts with Alumni and provide various services for Alumni of the University of Maine.

OtherAssets.Description: Interest in Alumni House joint venture

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The income from the endowments is made available to support operations, awards and scholarships.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: The Organization establishes funds for each reunion class at the University of Maine. Alumni contribute donations to these reunion class funds; distributions are then determined by the reunion class to further education at the University of Maine.

The Organization establishes funds for each reunion class at the University of Maine. Alumni contribute donations to these reunion class funds; distributions are then determined by the reunion class to further education at the University of Maine.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Method for Determining Number of Contributors:
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: The Organization is reporting the number of items received.
The Organization is placing the art on display in the lobby of their office.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: General Alumni Association of the University Of Maine, Inc. (the Association) (a Corporation) is a member organization for Alumni of the University of Maine (the University). All Alumni of the University of Maine are members of the University of Maine Alumni Association.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Members of the association elect members of the governing body.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 and the reviewed financial statements will initially be shared with the budget and finance committees, who are acting as the audit committee. After their review, both documents will be submitted to the executive committee. After that review, the business manager will email it to all board members. The Board Chair will then sign and submit the form.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Committee reviews and establishes the annual salary of the President after reviewing comparable salaries of other Alumni Association Directors of equal size in the New England region.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: When a request is received to view the documents, copies are provided by mail, email, website or can be viewed in the office.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Changes in Net Assets or Fund Balances:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Net unrealized gains on investments: 111,691. Prior period adjustments: 21,000.
The budget and finance committees act as the audit committee. This process has not changed from the prior year.
